references.paper_title: On the robustness to outliers of the student-t process
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical justification for the robustness of the Student's t-distribution in handling outliers, a key aspect of UniCAD's anomaly detection.
This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of the anomaly detection field, establishing the context and importance of unsupervised anomaly detection (UAD), the focus of UniCAD.

references.paper_title: Deep learning for anomaly detection: A survey
references.reason: This survey focuses on the application of deep learning to anomaly detection, a crucial element in UniCAD's representation learning stage.
This paper introduces the Local Outlier Factor (LOF) algorithm, a well-established clustering-based outlier detection method that is compared against in UniCAD's experiments.
This paper describes Gaussian Mixture Models (GMMs), the probabilistic model that underpins UniCAD's unified framework for representation learning, clustering, and anomaly detection.
